text: Aquem is a census town and a suburb of city of Margao in South Goa district in the state of Goa, India. It is home to the 6th Century Pandava caves which likely have Buddhist origin. ==Demographics== India census, Aquem had a population of 4985. Males constitute 51% of the population and females 49%. Aquem has an average literacy rate of 70%, higher than the national average of 59.5%; with 55% of the males and 45% of females literate. 13% of the population is under 6 years of age. ==References== Category:Cities and towns in South Goa district Category:Comunidades of Goa
title: Aquem
